data.text: EDIT : I was able to cash out and it processed pretty fast. I was surprised. I'm $4 away from the cash out minimum, and my check list keeps glitching. I past the requirement on one game, but it didn't check it off. And I downloaded a new game and passed the requirement and haven't gotten it. Plus there is no way to let the app know when you have a problem with an offer. UPDATE I am at the cash out point, but it want me to do a facial recognition and it wont accept it or somthing.

The variety of available games is better than most other play to earn services. I haven't hit the minimum payout yet, which I believe is a little high (the reason for 4 stars instead of 5), but I have heard of others cashing out. You just have to make sure you read the instructions for each game, some have different requirements. For some you have to finish all the goals, others you don't. Some have different limits on how long you have to finish quests. Overall I'm happy with it.

Played the Monopoly all the way, it stopped tracking it partway through, tried to cash out, won't cash out, tried township, began tracking it but then stopped. The whole thing is a waste of time and a scam. They just want information, your information, so they can sell it. You get no compensation for anything. And all the games want you to do is purchase, purchase, purchase. If you're evaluating things you shouldn't need to purchase. I give it a zero if that was an option

I do love the concept of this app, is better (so far) than any of the other earth money apps I've tried. The goals for each game are realistic, and achievable. I would like checking my progress on the games to simpler, however. Other than that I'd recommend it to friend and family. I would've given four our five stars, but haven't completed all of my goals yet\cashed out yet. But that's because I've only been using the app for a few weeks now.
data.replyText: Thank you for your kind review, Cassandra! We're glad to hear that you're enjoying the concept and finding the goals achievable. Keep up the great work on completing your goals!

data.text: I didn't play because after install and email sign up, it's pretty clear that games within app require tracking install...not worth any pay out for me personally . Also if forgetting to click "agree to terms" the prompt text refers to the terms & conditions as "hint". I'll update this review if I begin to receive spam email. Many of these types of apps just seem to be predator apps on folks needing groceries or rent funds.

The app runs a lot smoother than it did in the past, I am very pleased that they've improved since their beta testing. I've been awarded credits on time and haven't had many issues. The only parts I dislike are the payout and apps they display. Most of the apps displayed are apps that are either mostly pay-to-play after a certain level achieved or have extremely slow gameplay altogether. I lose interest too quickly - that's on me - but it's difficult to reach such a high payout of $70.

Pretty straightforward w/ a good selection of popular games; haven't reached enough for a payout yet (have to reach $70, which seems kinda excessive); I'll re-evaluate when I reach that point. Interface is a little slow - doesn't always show your progress immediately, but it has always shown up by the next day. A little more user instruction would be nice - for instance, do I have to open the game from the Testerup app each time, or will it track as long as I have downloaded it thru the app?

I really like the concept and idea of testerup. It pays you to play games and make a little extra money which is awesome. The only thing that I think needs improvement is the availability of certain information such as: date of when you start an offer, reminders that offers are ending, some kind of warning that your progress tracking has stopped - I know these are things that take a lot of time and work to implement but I feel like these things would improve the apps quality.

Have been playing a couple games and building up the credits before the time is up to cash out. Tried to play today after not playing for a couple days. Won't even open the games at all. Brings me to an error page even though none of the issues shown apply to me. THIS IS BOGUS!!!!! Their suggestion to solve my issue was to open from the app. Ummm... duh. That's how I always opened it. Don't waste your time with this one.
data.replyText: We are sorry to hear that you had this experience! Our support team is helping you resolve the situation as soon as possible. Kind regards!

data.text: Testerup has been a pleasure to use and the rewards are straight forward and fair. The app library has a good variety of genres to choose from allowing for a wide audience of testers. I also like that I get an email when completing a task for confirmation and the tracking of progress via using their download link on android is convenient. Currently my favorite game rewards platform and interface.

Currently looking hopeful, if it does pay out that would be amazing, it even provides recommend purchases which get some decent cash back but also speeds up the test goals quite a bit (purchases range from 5-30$). Some of these if you are strategic will mark of requirements totaling more than purchases cost a long with the cash back. You really need to go and look at the games purchasesing strategies.

Pretty awesome app and has a decent variety of games to select from. Some of the tasks on the game app(s) selected are a little ridiculous and would require too much time and effort for little payout. I do wish the minimum payout amount cap was a good bit lower because reaching the $70 minimum payout requirement is a little too high and at times very challenging to reach. Currently, I am over all happy with this app and would definitely recommend it to others!

So far, I like the app.. although it seems the tracking isn't accurate or the task is a bit far fetched. I know I'll like or enjoy playing within 10 to 20 minutes and most of the time you run out lives or coins to reach the levels to complete a task and I don't like that you can't continue playing and earning after leaving, but of coarse you can keep continuing to play at anytime. Just doesn't seem reasonable. Please fix... then I may reconsider. Thanks ðŸ˜Š

It's a great app with excellent game choices. It ACTUALLY pays out! I have never had trouble cashing out just be patient bc it may take a few days or so to deposit. The only issues I have is that I wish apps that I played,before ever knowing about testerup, I could replay and get credit. Also, the amount of work they are asking for, the levels you must complete, for the amount they are giving and the time they want you to complete it in for some games are a little far fetched.

As always I give true, detailed and informative reviews based solely on my experience. The four stars given are conditional based on potential for payout which I have not completed yet. The app had a few glitches at sign up; a little difficult. I started an offer but it's not keeping track. If it continues to not record my progress I will contact customer service. The layout look and feel of the app is comfortable and somewhat easy to navigate, this said; I have nothing but high expectations.

True to its word, you do get paid for playing games. Some games are more stingy than others. The app itself is not great. You can't see what the payout levels are until you accept the task, hitting the back button instead of the red X closes the app instead of taking you back to the menu, and it takes you back to the top instead of where you were. You also run the risk of getting banned if you can't remember every game you've ever played and accept one that you've played before.

I was amazed when I found the Testerup app, mainly with the amt of money that can be made . I've been doing these other playing games for money, just a few dollars here and there. Which helped. And the way it's all set up, it's easy, except for the tracking, I had a very hard time finding it in my phone. I'll will update this review when I've completed Match Masters and cashed out. I love it !!!;

This app is intriguing; it operates similarly to other play-to-win money or gift card platforms, but with a unique twist. To receive payment, you need to opt out of a game, regardless of your progress level. Consequently, the app displays zero dollars until you take that step. I haven't cashed out yet, so I don't know yet if it's 100% legit yet, but looks promising.

This app. Is quite interesting. It appears to work like all the other play to win money or gift card sites. But, it does things a little differently. You have to opt. Out of a game to get paid no matter where you are in the level process, so the app still shows you having Zero dollars until you do that. Have cashed out of anything yet, so I'm not even sure how payment works. Will add more when I do.p

In order to be paid you have to spend a LOT of time in the game. It's very difficult to reach the goals in the allotted time unless you have nothing else to do but play each game. In order to be paid the full advertised amount you will have to make in app purchases but these are optional; not sure whether the entire amount is reimbursed. They do have good games though, for this type of platform. (Amusing that they list it as a financial app.)

They offered to pay for this rating then stiffed me...You have to finish ALL tasks to get paid for the games. So far all I have looked at requires purchases to finish task list. Most seem to be nearly impossible to complete in time even if I had the money to pay them to maybe pay me. Not to mention that it requires a minimum $70 to withdraw money. Avoid this if you don't want to waste time grinding just to get bent over.

I like the concept behind testerup, but I feel like it could use more work when it comes to checking your progress on individual games through the app. Other than that my experience so far has been very good. I especially like that the games it offers for testing aren't your basic or average solitaire and colors matching games your find on every other app. They offer ones with actual playability and they can actually be really fun. Overall I enjoy using testerup.

I already play mobile games in my spare time, so i enjoy the concept of being rewarded for them. This site has been the best about expectations of effort invested on certain tasks, like what levels you have to hit to recieve what dollar amount. Only thing I don't like is you need $70 to be able to cash out, however, its easier to get to this cap then some of its competitors where you can play for hours and never see the payout.

VERY buggy app. Sometimes it will lose track of an app you have been playing for months and they will tell you to basically go yourself. The app also never works over data. My data doesn't seem that bad as I have no issues with anything else ever just this app. Payouts are dumb and require a lot more work than other apps. I suggest you just use a competitor. They are almost all better.

It's a little slow at times. As far as the app goes it's simple to follow & easy to see. Not so easy to navigate at first. Couldn't find my way back to start because only had refer a friend. Figured it out though. Main thing concerned about is availability to talk to someone about actual downloading & getting credit. Downloaded an app from the link & played to like level 70 before I returned to testerup app to find that got no credit at all.

This app appears to be legit and it's fun. I haven't requested a payout yet because I'm aiming for the whole amount It's different than all the other payment for tasks apps I've tried before. They offer you a substantial payment amount for completing the whole task and answering questions at the end. There are multi-reward goals you can achieve along the way. You have the option of ending the task at any time for partial payment based only on what goals you've completed. I like these options!!

Has a great selection of games. I don't tend to use my personal funds to improve my odds on advancing in the games. So it does take me a tad longer to hit a goal. I just wish the cash out option as a little lower. I use the Benjamin app and it has a 25 min payout. I would user tester up wayyyy more if it lowered the withdraw amount to sat 35 or 40. I bounce around on games bc I can't maintain focus for long periods of time. But it is a great app and pays out!

Over the past couple of weeks, I tested many different apps to earn money through games and surveys, and out of all of them, TesterUp, alongside maybe one or two others, has really held its ground. the system of using actually monetary values instead of points like other apps really speaks to me. The only point of criticism I personally have, is that many of the late goals are almost impossible to achieve if you don't play every day for long periods of time or rely on money.

Overall this is a great way to pass time and even make some money for playing games. The layout is pretty easy to figure out and all. The only thing I don't like is how much time u need to put in to get a dollar. Also the different levels need to pass in games sometimes take a while or u might be able to put money into a game to move forward faster. But I will give it 4stars or like 95% overall.

This app allows you to earn money playing games from the comfort of your own home. They have a good game selection and most games are easy to level up. You get paid little amounts when you reach certain levels until you reach the end and get your complete payout amount or if you decide you dont want to play you can opt to quit game and keep your earnings but it wont allow you to actually get your cash until you reach 70$. I think that they should allow you to cash out as long as you have 2$ & up

My fiancee and I both use testerup, and love it! We've yet to cash out any rewards, but we're both actively testing several games for the app. I really like the simplicity of the app, although I would suggest done improvements to the UI. Overall it's easy to use, but there are some difficulties navigating until you've figured it out. The whole thing feels like a quickly made browser, which is fine, because you spend the majority of your time off the app grinding out the games. Thanks for the app

Has the best selection of games (IMHO) of the pay for playing apps I've tried, but starting to think it's a scam. 1 game loads then error: Contact Customer Support. 2 games aren't crediting me for completing levels (I'm @ Level 90 on one), not even for launching (it's been > week) ! I downloaded/launched through Tester Up & did all the help page listed. Nope. Got blank page/error for Nielsen (they say $4.50 for 4 min.). NO RESPONSE to EMAILS to tech support w/required screen shots.

Have not cashed out yet but so far I'm really liking that it actually records game, unlike some other apps... And it does so without having to open game through the app. What I don't like is if I hit the back button to go to lists of games it closes the app. A search bar to look for specific games would be nice. Also a personal screen that shows installed games.

Cashed out a couple times. So far it has been decent and you have the ability to play games while making a small amount of money. You have to reach certain goals in the games within a time limit to recieve a reward. As you progress and recieve rewards you can end a playthrough at anytime and get the rewards that you have reached. But there is a cash out limit you must reach in order to cash out. All in all its a good way to make chump change.

Great and legitimate app. Would rate 5 out of 5 BUT you have to earn $70 to cash out, which is a lot, and several of the apps are not available on my phone/in my country. With that being said, the app is pretty great. The games available are fun, the rewards are not too difficult to reach, and when you do hit 70 dollars real money is sent to the platform you select it to be sent.

I have tried a lot of other apps and you go to cash out and it says you must complete other goals or you are number whatever inline. Not this app. You can choose when you want to end the task and what task you end on you receive that amount. You have to reach $70to cash out but it doesn't take long to make it there. So many awesome games to choose from. Plus it's all free.

Not sure what is going on. I downloaded 3 games. Of the 3 one didn't track the download and install/launch of the game. One I got credit for the install and launch but that was it even though I past many of the tasks on the list. On the 3rd game I got credit for the install and the first task but none that followed even though I passed the tasks in the same game playing session. I was really hoping that it would work because I liked the concept of the setup but it just doesn't seem like it was.

Pays out pretty well. The app functionality is good. As long as you play the games consistently you can earn money in a decent amount of time. Some games require a time frame so if your looking to grind games go for those. There's games that don't require a time from but the amount you'll get when you finish decreases a little bit but not by much. So just play consistently and payout will be good when you finish a few games!

I like the app so far. It has a variety of games to choose from and they give you ample time to complete tasks. A couple.of the apps took a little longer than expect r d but I was given the option to end early and t o move on to another It.seems pretty fair. Other than there is a set amount you have to reach in order to cashout and I have not reached that goal as of yet. I.will change my rating Ä·knce I see this actually.pays.

This app presents a straightforward manner of executing apps for the purpose of testing them and being rewarded for their use. There are ample instructions to walk even the newest of users through the process. The TesterUp app does not force you to watch ads, out to go through multiple rounds of tasks (other than those of testing the apps) to receive your payout. The only issue I have with the app, is that the button to exit the app test page and return to the homepage is broken.

Love this app! Best payout of any other game test apps ive used. I like that each stage/task is checked off as you complete it so you know what all you've still got left to finish, and exactly how much each item has earned you. My only issue has been that several of the tests I've tried to do weren't available for my device. I've cashed out twice so far (made over $200) and payments go to paypal within a few days. Cash out limit seems high, but because of the high payouts, it doesn't take long.

Edit* They will not let you cash out till you reach $70. I'm not wasting my time on another spp that has s cab out threshold. I have been using the app about a month. The app is user friendly and easy to understand. They have many games to chose from but I wish they had more. Also would like to see them have an option to show the apps I'm currently using instead of scrolling through the list.

A 4* for now just because I haven't asked for a payment yet and want to see for myself it's legit before a up my rating. Very straight forward with what they want you to do for each offer and each offer has multiple tasks within the offer and each task has an amount each task is worth. Easy to understand and so far very transparent with what Is offered and as well expected to do. You can do it at home or on the road if traveling. Can't get any easier this app right here.

The app is very simple to use as there are only 3 main tabs at the top. I was a little disappointed at the selection of games a beginner sees, as they are very popular and I had already installed several which disqualified me from testing them. On the positive side of that is the fact that the game selection at first appearance is quality trustworthy game publishers.

i have used similar apps for a few years now and i definitely believe this one is a promising addition, but it is very frustrating to install a game, play it, and not receive any confirmation that it has been installed. the app home page is not designed very well and overall UI is confusing and not intuitive.

I haven't had the Testerup App for very long, but so far, it has proven to be a little aggravating at times. I follow the instructions perfectly and still have a hard time getting credited for my task. I like the overall concept but really don't like how hard it is to get credited for the work I've done. Im open to help and suggestions to help make it a bit easier for me.

Over the years I've tried quite a few apps and websites that offer some type of money for playing games or testing apps and so on, to date this is the most transparent and if not the highest paying then in the top percentile. I've even added it to my website goldgoodsguru ext. /gotthustle because of it's ability to make money doing something you're already likely doing.

Loads up great, pretty much starts with offers. Not sure where your progress is but found that when installing game rules there is a progress area but keeps loading and not doing anything . I think it's confusing and still trying to figure out how to get credit and play game

I enjoy playing games in my free time especially when I can make a little extra money doing so. So far I have not had any issue with the app. I have not gotten to do a payout yet because I haven't reached the limit so hopefully all will go well. The only fault I see is that they offer good money for completion on the games but you can never reach or complete the while game in the time frame alloted. It is still fun to play so overall for now I am happy with the app.

Since I'm new haven't been able to cash out anything yet, but they do have a good variety of different types of games for all different interests. And I like how u can end the game early without losing what you earned so far, I apologize if I misread it, but regardless it's fun and known games too. It's not one that only has games that a first year app designer made ðŸ˜‰ðŸ‘

A great concept. I am having a pleasant experience thus far with the games through the Testerup app. There is a wide variety to choose from which I also enjoy. Although, I do have one minor concern regarding the accuracy of the goal tracking system in the app. I have followed the instructions and downloaded and opened a game through the app and have met the first goal yet it has not updated my progress. However, I would like to mention the goal tracking system is working on another game ðŸ‘

I really like the idea of getting rewarded for achievement within the games themselves, rather than just the length of time played. The large money goals don't seem very achievable within the time limit, however as you get rewarded for stages along the way that doesn't bother me too much. When I got to Â£70 I requested payout to PayPal and it was done within 24 hours! Very happy! Takes a while to build up but the reward is worth it!

Would be nicer if you didn't have to go into each app to see if you've received the reward.. and the rewards take forever to show. But it's fun playing the different games. Read everything before you get sucked in. It was not reading the proper level. And to get it corrected was a major pain. Today I decided to cash out... realized that the minimum to cash out was $70.00. Which would take forever. Save yourself the trouble and use a different platform.

I'm done. If I could do 0 stars I would. If I need to contact support 3 times, there's a problem. It worked okay for bit, but not long enough to withdraw anything. Then suddenly one of the games decided to stop working, saying it's not available in my country(showing US and Germany) I live in Canada.... I didn't change anything on my end. The video advertissement for this is erroneous and false. I'm done. Delete.

Testerup as a concept sounded great reading the listing online. I will say $70 as the minimum withdraw amount is sorta high compared to other apps. Tracking for rewards on apps is hit or miss, and I've been stuck at the 3rd reward spot for a game for the past day. I've definitely surpassed it now, and there's no clear option to request support in-app. The options I've had for games seem diverse and actually enjoyable, with decent payouts listed. Not a great start, but giving it a chance.

Just started using the app, and it seems simple enough. The games you can test are pretty simple, but not sure whether the full extent of the rewards they're offering are doable without spending money on said games to make the required progress for maximum layout. The testing process is easy to understand and it seems that the goals are updated in reasonable time of you achieving them. Will have to wait and see about the payout, as have not gotten the required Â£70, but will see in the future.

Downgraded to two stars. I have some issues with the app. Not very user friendly, I have repeatedly had to close the app once you check to view a game. Clicking to view a game is slow and take ages to load. I had to reactivate one of the deal I was already doing but can no longer progress down the tasks list due to it not updating. Lastly I got to and completed one of the list for dicey dreams but it would not update to give me the last task completed tick so I missed out on 20 something pound.

Good idea. However needs to add more games for non premium members. Also the amount to which you can withdraw is high. Overall the concept is a great idea. Just wish it would track properly and accept screenshot rather than having to take screen recordings to prove you have completed a level despite clearly tracking the completed levels AFTER the one that has not been tracked....

Bit of a scam. You can't cash out until you have Â£70 in your account, which is impossible to achieve without making in game purchases. Furthermore, their tracking doesn't always work, so cashback qualifying purchases don't register and you end up not getting your money. Also they don't respond to contact regarding this. *Update* I notice the developer responded quickly enough to a negative review on Play Store, but still has not responded to my support ticket or honoured their advertised rewards
data.replyText: Thanks for your remarks. Please note that your support ticket won't be ignored. Sometimes our customer support team needs more time to investigate the issue. Thanks for your patience! Kind regards.

data.text: Twice progress did not update. When I queried this with their customer service team I was told that their system had logged an irregularity so I would not get this. Apparently this may be down to using a VPN, which I did not, but they had no interest in investigating the issue fully to establish what the actual problem was, and instead just declined my earnings.
data.replyText: Dear Helen, thank you for your input. We acknowledge your concern that you feel we didn't thoroughly investigate your case. If you have any uncertainties, please reach out to our support team once more, providing additional information regarding why VPN usage was detected on your account. We apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused.

data.text: So far so good, seems to be crediting accurately for achievements. A reasonable selection of games which I assume will expand with time. Yet to cash out so will return to review once I have. One slight flaw, it's a little irritating that using my back arrow when selected through to details of a game closes the app rather than go back to the overview screen.

The best $$$ app I have found. So it is extremely easy to navigate. The levels of games I've passed so far it shows me how much I've accumulated. You do have to get up to $70.00 before cashing out though. It does take a lil time but honestly it's so easy.

Straightforward and well laid out interface, tasks are varied from game to game and clearly state how much each task pays. Only downside is that they don't say what the tasks inside a game are until you start, meaning the clock has started. So if you are using the app I would recommend trying to focus on one or two games at a time.

I found the concept of the Testerup app quite intriguing. Its user-friendly interface and comprehensive features make it a valuable tool for testing various functionalities of applications. The app offers a seamless experience, allowing users to efficiently conduct tests and provide feedback. Overall, I believe Testerup has great potential to streamline the testing process for developers and improve the quality of applications.

Really great app for making that little bit extra pocket money. I've always played games on my mobile device so this is great for me. The app itself is very user friendly, no bugs or crashes and I've never had a problem with the app monitoring my progress on a game. The only tiny issue I personally have is that I have played a lot of the games before so I am unable to play them through the tester up app to get the rewards as you have to be a new user. So adding more games would be great for me

the up concept is good. the game options available are good and enjoyable.Most of them are easy and straightforward. it would have been nicer to have more than 30 days to complete certain game level as they are very hard to. specially as the games themselves don't make it easy to pass a level without expectation of spending money first.

I like the concept of the Testerup app. Being able to play games and earn a bit while doing sp sounds like an incredible deal. So far the app is working pretty well. I'm able to download games and play them and the app tracks my progress and check off the goals. I haven't cashed out yet but I see that other people haven't had trouble with it so I'm hopeful that everything will work out since the app has worked well for me so far!

The games are great but there is no end date for the timeframe when someone starts. The payout threshold is a bit too high ($70). I know you want people to play the games but make it more reasonable like $30 or $50. Not everyone can reach that in the time limit (30 - 60 days). Life gets in the way sometimes and we lose track of time so whenever we get free time, we play. You will need to update the app and put a end date and couple of reminders so the gamer would know when the time expires.
data.replyText: We appreciate your feedback! We'll definitely take your suggestions into consideration for future updates to add reminders for the timeframe. Thank you for playing and sharing your thoughts with us!

data.text: I have really enjoyed trying the app out. The fact you can earn money while resting games I have not tried before. I like the concept of being able to finish the list of challenges whenever you want. If you get board, then you still earn a little from completing a couple of objectives. I do lime the ability to do that. I also like how you can see the trailers on the app as well to see if it is something you want to play.

Great app - task list updates fairly quickly and good range of games to play - good payout amounts too. Only feedback, and I may have missed it, but it should mention that games you've previously downloaded and played won't count as this can cause confusion. I found it reading an FAQ when my tasks weren't updating and I had to try and find out why.

I have been enjoying this app so far and about halfway to the cash out requirement. I enjoy the game options that they give you and that there is a variety of different styles of games. The only downfall for me is a lot of the offers are for new players only and I have already played most of them so it makes it a little harder to get to the $70 dollar minimum. Over all I do enjoy and would recommend......provided it ends up actually cashing out lol.

Actually found a couple of games I enjoy so it's quite enjoyable. And I like getting the emails saying I've earned another bit of money towards the goal. EDIT: Was enjoying the app, but now it's not registering goals on certain games such as dice dreams and candy crush. Is be well over the Â£70 by now if it was working properly, and it's been a week since I emailed them
data.replyText: Dear Lewis, we apologize for the inconvenience with the goal tracking, our team will get back to you soon to provide a solution. Thank you for your patience!

data.text: I really like that I have the chance to earn more than just a few pence by playing games and doing other tasks whilst sitting at home. What would be really helpful is a button to click 'Already played this game'. So many of the games offered have been around for quite a while and I've played before. It's a pain to have to go through the claim process just to knock them off the screen. I also agree about not responding to tickets. I've been waiting over 2 weeks for a response & haven't had one.

I was skeptical at first, unsure of the validity of this type of app experience and just wanted to put a few extra bucks in my pocket. I can sat now that I am very pleased with my experience thus far. I like that you have an ultimate amount of money available to earn at the completion of each offer. I like that there are many possible offers to pick from, and I have found my choices to be achievable and fun. I am going to unload my other cash apps and give more of my time and energy to this one.

Love the idea of the app . Very easy to understand and progress , however the lack of selection of games is a minor issue as it means I don't typically play for fun and just feels like work sometimes. Also cannot comment on the payout of the app currently as have not reached the 70 pound goal however will definitely continue with the use of the app going forward.

I haven't had a chance to fully test the app, but I am impressed with the selection of games to choose from. The $70 minimum to cash out seems high, but I'll need to complete a few offers to get a better idea of â€‹â€‹whether that amount is possible. Overall, I like the concept and design of the app and I think I can make money.

The app sounds really good when you first begin to read it and I would love to play it but every time that I've tried it all it does is freeze up on the game that I enjoy playing so much so I have to download and redownload the game, so I'm tired of trying and trying to play this and get paid for it cuz I've had the game for about 3 and 1/2 months. Nothing is happening, so at this point I'm getting up.

It is a decent app so far. However I've had trouble with it tracking all my goals. Like it tracked one part of my progress but didn't track the other progress. It has not tracked 2 other games and task. But I have high hopes it will be worked out. My friend has played this and gotten payed for it. So fingers crossed.

I've had a great experience with TesterUp. The app allows you to earn money by testing games, which is a unique and enjoyable opportunity. I like being able to complete the list of challenges at my own time, even earning a little when I'm bored and just complete a few objectives. We can watch game trailers on the app is also a nice feature, helping me decide which games to try.

I think the concept of this is brilliant. It's a little extra pocket money, while you also find new games to play. I have found a few that have got me hooked. I would say some of the targets a bit hard sometimes but it's all possible. I think there should various targets or possibly it could be worth upping some of the values for the games. I think a few more games aswell. But overall no major complaints.

So I can honestly say, this is definitely one of the most respectable, straightforward, play for pay apps ive ever used. I have about 6 other similar apps, such as mistplay, justplay, Richie games, etc. But NONE of them offer any payouts even remotely close to the ones Testerup does. The only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is because of the fact tht u have to make in-app purchases at the end of some tasks to get the full payout but it's only about $5 to complete the task and they reimburse u

Love the whole premise of this app. No paywall, just play new games and earn money in the process. Was easy to set up, and you are promptly notified if you have completed one of the goals (e.g. reaching a certain level) as well as the remunartion attached to it! My only reservation is the min cashout level; just manage your expectations. You won't get paid out the day you first download it (unless you're a hardcore gamer on a mission) Play games, get paid, what's not to like? Go testerup!

I was pleasantly surprised by this app! I've used plenty of play and earn apps and this by far might be favorite,( once I do my first cash out I will update review contingent upon that). The app is very easy to use, straightforward, and the tasks are attainable. I also love that you don't have to make an in-app purchase. My only small concern was the cash out amount is a little high. All in all amazing app, so far so good!

Everything seems transparent, but I haven't been able to cash anything out until I finish my activities. I didn't want to overload myself unless I KNOW FOR SURE all is well. Once I finish & am able to cash out without any issues, I will bump it up to 5 stars. Until then, I say, definitely give it a chance. Download was simple, offers seems easy enough to attain & directions easy to follow. Simply follow the prompts & it leads you where you need to go. So far, so good!

It is a good app for making a little money for games that you would probably already play. It is also a good way to find games that you maybe interested in. The rate at which you get played is determined by how fast you reach the milestones set up for the game downloaded not by how long you play the game. There is a set amount you have to reach that is a bit high before you can withdraw anything which to me maybe the only drawback.

i thought the app was good. i started on dice dreams. I got to the level 23 payout and it didn't credit me in the progress part it just has a spinning circle like its refreshing. I carried on and the next 2 check got a tick fine. then I completed the final point for level 50 and nothing at all happened. I carried on and got to level 60 and still didn't update so I contacted customer support then didn't hear off them for 11 days till I message again and there excuse is I used a vpn which I didnt

I love this app. The games are fun and it's easy to earn extra money. Edit.... 5 days ago I finally reached the $70 needed for payout. It took me 2 months to get there which is a long time. Requesting payout is kinda easy. Verify your a person with a video selfie and then it's just a few clicks away. Payout isn't instant as it should be. It's been 5 days and I'm still waiting. I'd give no stars if I could. ITS A SCAM

So far, super slow on the current games I am playing. Most of the selection of games is not the type of games I would play. But it does have some fun ones. Only earned like 1.50$ so far, and you can not cash out until 70$. Willing to continue trying, I will update when I see better results.
data.replyText: Thank you for your feedback, John! We're constantly working to improve offer selection. Keep playing and earning, we hope you'll see higher results and rewards soon! Good luck.

data.text: It isn't a bad app at all, I was recommended by someone to try it out and they showed that they got payed by it as well, though currently I'm trying to get to the 70$ withdrawal, it does reward you with a wide variety of games and offers that pay a good amount to test and leave reviews on the app.

So far so good... Enjoying the different games/apps and the fact to there is a wide selection to choose from. The tasks and time provided for completion are seemingly reasonable which is a serious plus. I recommend the app.

Scam! I played one game and it gave me $.80 credit that I can see but not get. Then I played puzzles and chaos and it was supposed to start giving me credit when I level my castle up to level 5. I am now at level 9 and still no credit. For some reason when I start the game it wants me to review it and asks me why I don't want to play and gives me a checkbox to earn $0 of the $120. There is no support number to call.

I wold have given 5 stars but playing the games allows the reward to be as much as all those other apps and the choices are pretty much all the same. I thought it might have done a little bit more than it's apparent equals.

I haven't even tried the game yet. I've downloaded other apps that offer rewards and I hate the ads, there are entirely to long and to many that I can't enjoy, and the change I can do without so I will be deleting the app.
data.replyText:
We are sorry to learn that you have decided to leave us, LaShawn. Thanks for your feedback though.
Kind regards.

data.text: So far so,so good.. I haven't been able to get a few of the games to download properly so I can get the offers that are being displayed. I've done followed the directions precisely and I couldn't get new games that are being displayed. I seem to see that when I try to download a game it doesn't seem to connect to tester-up? When I'm on the tester-up app.. I try a couple times and give up.. other than that I have no issues. I will continue to try because I like the offers.. thanks.

A truly beautiful and elegant system that is secure, accurate, and pays good. This is better then Inboxdollars and drumo along with the rest of the pay for play apps that just don't compete with Testerup , hands down the #1 app for getting paid to play. Thank you!

Since I installed it, I've only been able to open it (almost)once then it kicks me to main menu every single time I try.. no matter what I've tried.. it's always the same result. Wish I could get further but until then I won't change my review. Please help me enjoy this app somehow..

I find the app easy to use however there is no way to accept your money from the games after the period has elapsed. You'd imagine that it auto collects it for you but it doesn't. Other then that it seems to work fine I haven't made enough yet to cash out
Tester up is a wonderful app that allows users to comfortably try new games and take while on the go or in bed. It's amazing. The layout is easy, the concept is great. Give it a try.

Nice app, good concept and i like the games. I think the payout minimum should be smaller or more reasonable. Will update rating once i'm able to confirm payout. Update 3/6/24 - Good app, fun games and actually pays out. I would love more games to choose from. Overall, i don't really have many complaints.

Great interface but can be a little tricky in some instances. Most importantly it really pays, though the cash out threshold is ridiculously high at $70. On the other hand once you've reached that... It's a nice PAYOUT!!$%
